meanings.definition: A person new to a particular activity or job, especially one who is inexperienced or unskilled.
meanings.sent1: The tenderfeet in the hiking group struggled to keep up with the experienced climbers.
meanings.sent2: The camp counselor patiently guided the tenderfeet through their first canoeing trip.
meanings.sent3: The tenderfeet at the cooking class accidentally mistook sugar for salt, creating a sweet disaster.
meanings.sent4: In the world of coding, the tenderfeet are like newborn ducklings trying to navigate a vast digital pond.
meanings.sent5: The tenderfeet in the dance class stumbled and twirled, their enthusiasm shining brighter than their footwork.

meanings.sent1: The group of tenderfeet gathered nervously at the starting line of the race.
meanings.sent2: The tenderfeet explored the forest, marveling at the beauty of nature around them.
meanings.sent3: The tenderfeet in the choir accidentally sang a note too early, creating a harmonious mess.
meanings.sent4: Among the seasoned travelers, the tenderfeet stood out like fresh daisies in a field of wildflowers.
meanings.sent5: The tenderfeet in the art class eagerly dipped their brushes into a rainbow of colors, ready to create masterpieces.
